org.usfirst.frc.team2077.video.interfaces

Interface RenderingProjection

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractProjection, Birdseye, CubeMap3x2, Equidistant, Equirectangular, Equisolid, InverseTangentProjection, Orthographic, Perspective, SineProjection, Stereographic, TangentProjection

    public interface RenderingProjection
    Forward projection and coordinate transform math for video rendering. The purpose of the rendering projection is to present the video data in the desired form for presentation to either the human viewers or downstream processing. Wide angle, fisheye, and/or multiple cameras may provide large field of view coverage, but significantly distort all or part of it. In combination with correct source projections configured to provide normalized spherical image data, well chosen rendering projections can present the most important parts of the overall field in the most usable form for the intended purpose. Sources that are normalized to a common global coordinate space may also be rendered into a single view to "stitch" multiple feeds into a single panorama, birdseye, or other projection, even if the cameras that produce them are not perfectly matched.

    While the interface defines several methods, its core is renderingProjection(double, double), which describes the pure projection function by mapping from normalized cartesian projection space to the spherical world coordinates produced by the SourceProjection of the video source. Other functions may typically be handled in a common base class.

    Rendering projections are created by Renderings and are required to have a constructor taking parameters (String name, RenderedView view), where name is its configuration property prefix and view is the containing RenderedView.

    Â© 2018

    Author:
    FRC Team 2077, R. A. Buchanan

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isGlobal()
      Global source coordinate flag.
      double[] renderingProjection(double x, double y)
      Maps normalized source projection coordinates to source image coordinates.
      double[] transformPixelToCartesian(double renderingPixelX, double renderingPixelY)

    • Method Detail

      • transformViewToRendering

        double[] transformViewToRendering(double viewPixelX,
                                  double viewPixelY)
        Maps a point in view image coordinates to rendering image space.
        Parameters:
        viewPixelX - Horizontal image coordinate in range 0 to width from left.
        viewPixelY - Vertical image coordinate in range 0 to width from top.
        Returns:
        {
        renderingPixelX (Horizontal image coordinate in range 0 to width from left),
        renderingPixelY (Vertical image coordinate in range 0 to width from top)
        }.

      • transformPixelToCartesian

        double[] transformPixelToCartesian(double renderingPixelX,
                                   double renderingPixelY)
        Maps a point in rendering image coordinates to normalized rendering projection space.
        Parameters:
        renderingPixelX - Horizontal image coordinate in range 0 to width from left.
        renderingPixelY - Vertical image coordinate in range 0 to width from top.
        Returns:
        {
        x (Horizontal projection space coordinate in range -1 to 1),
        y (Vertical projection space coordinate on same scale)
        }.

      • renderingProjection

        double[] renderingProjection(double x,
                             double y)
        Maps normalized source projection coordinates to source image coordinates. Maps a point in normalized projection coordinates to view-relative spherical vector.
        Parameters:
        x - Horizontal projection space coordinate in range -1 to 1.
        y - Vertical projection space coordinate on same scale.
        Returns:
        {
        azimuth (Viewer-relative spherical azimuth angle in radians clockwise from upward),
        polar (Viewer-relative spherical normal angle in radians outward from view axis)
        }.

      • transformRenderingToWorld

        double[] transformRenderingToWorld(double azimuth,
                                   double polar)
        Maps source-relative spherical view vector to world-relative spherical coordinates as supplied by source. World coordinate space is defined by the video source, and is relative to either the view axis of the source itself or to a global upward-looking axis.
        Parameters:
        azimuth - Viewer-relative spherical azimuth angle in radians clockwise from upward.
        polar - Viewer-relative spherical normal angle in radians outward from view axis.
        Returns:
        {
        azimuth (Viewer-relative spherical azimuth angle in radians clockwise from upward),
        polar (Viewer-relative spherical normal angle in radians outward from view axis)
        }.
        See Also:
        SourceProjection.transformGlobalWorldToSource(double, double), SourceProjection.transformNominalWorldToSource(double, double)

      • isGlobal

        boolean isGlobal()
        Global source coordinate flag.
        Returns:
        True if the rendering projection expects the source to use global (vs source-relative) coordinates.
